intro: Heterotis obamae, commonly known as Obama's catfish, is a species of catfish native to the rivers of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Claridae and is characterized by its elongated, eel-like body and a distinctive pattern of dark spots. The plant aspect refers to its aquatic habitat, where it thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments. It plays a role in the ecosystem as both a predator and a prey species. Due to its unique appearance and association with the former U.S. President, it has gained attention in conservation efforts.
